<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left"></div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .2in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)&nbsp;Includes intercompany mark-up, priced on an arms-length basis,
on products purchased from the company&#146;s product divisions, which is</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">eliminated in
IBM&#146;s consolidated results.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .2in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(b)&nbsp;Entire amount eliminated for purposes of IBM&#146;s consolidated results
and therefore does not appear on pages&nbsp;4 and 5.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .2in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(c)&nbsp;These assets, along with other financing assets in this table,
are leveraged at the value in the table using Global Financing debt.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .2in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(d)&nbsp;Global Financing debt is comprised of intercompany loans and external
debt. A portion of Global Financing debt is in support of the</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">company&#146;s
internal business, or related to intercompany mark-up embedded in the Global
Financing assets. See table on page&nbsp;59.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">56<a name="PB_56_081622_5335"></a></font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='56',FILE='C:\JMS\105540\10-5717-1\task4071170\5717-1-bo.htm',USER='105540',CD='Apr 26 21:19 2010' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;"><a href="#TableOfContents" title="Click to go to Table of Contents">Table of Contents</a></font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Management Discussion &#151;
(continued)</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Sources and Uses of Funds</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:15.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The primary use of funds
in Global Financing is to originate client and commercial financing assets.
Client financing assets for end users consist primarily of IBM systems,
software and services, but also include non-IBM equipment, software and
services to meet IBM clients&#146; total solutions requirements. Client financing
assets are primarily sales-type, direct financing and operating leases for
systems products, as well as loans for systems, software and services with
terms generally from two to seven years. Global Financing&#146;s client loans are
primarily for software and services and are unsecured. These</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">loans are subjected to additional credit
analysis to evaluate the associated risk and, when deemed necessary, actions
are taken to mitigate risks in the loan agreements which include covenants to
protect against credit deterioration during the life of the obligation. Client
financing also includes internal activity as described on page&nbsp;24 of the
2009 IBM Annual Report.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:15.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Commercial financing
receivables arise primarily from inventory and accounts receivable financing
for dealers and remarketers of IBM and non-IBM products. Payment terms for
inventory financing and accounts receivable financing generally range from 30
to 90 days.&#160; These short-term receivables
are primarily unsecured and are also subjected to additional credit analysis in
order to evaluate the associated risk.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">At March&nbsp;31,
2010, substantially all financing assets are IT related assets, and
approximately 60 percent of the external portfolio is with investment grade
clients with no direct exposure to consumers or mortgage assets.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Originations</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

external and internal financing originations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:21.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Cash
collections of both commercial and client financing assets exceeded new
financing originations in both the first quarter of 2010 and 2009, which
resulted in a net decline in total financing assets for these periods. The
increase in originations was due to improving volumes in commercial financing.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Cash
generated by Global Financing was primarily deployed to pay the intercompany
payables and dividends to </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">IBM</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

and Allowances</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Unallocated allowance for
  doubtful accounts</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.88%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:13.84%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">85</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.88%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:13.84%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">120</font></p>

  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Roll-Forward of Financing
Receivables Allowance for Doubtful Accounts</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(Dollars&nbsp;in&nbsp;millions)</font></p>

  </td>

 <tr height="0">
  <td width="8" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="100" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="19" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="7" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="83" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="19" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="7" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="83" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="19" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="7" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="83" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="19" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="7" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="83" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="7" style="border:none;"></td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left"></div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">*&#160;&#160; Represents reserved receivables, net of
recoveries, which were disposed of during the period.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">** Primarily represents
translation adjustments.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:21.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The percentage of Global
Financing receivables reserved increased from 2.1 percent at December&nbsp;31,
2009 to 2.3 percent at March&nbsp;31, 2010 primarily due to the seasonal
decline in the gross financing receivables balance from December&nbsp;31, 2009.&#160; Specific reserves increased 2.1 percent from
$416 million at December&nbsp;31, 2009 to $425 million at March&nbsp;31, 2010.
Unallocated reserves decreased $35 million from $120 million at December&nbsp;31,
2009 to $85 million at March&nbsp;31, 2010 due to the decline in gross
financing receivables.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Global Financing&#146;s bad
debt expense was an increase of $1 million for the three months ended March&nbsp;31,
2010, compared with an increase of $71 million for the three months ended March&nbsp;31,
2009. The decrease in bad debt expense was attributed to the decline of
required specific reserve additions.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Residual Value</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:15.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Residual value is
a risk unique to the financing business and management of this risk is
dependent upon the ability to accurately project future equipment values at lease
inception.&#160; Global Financing has insight
into product plans and cycles for the IBM products under lease.&#160; Based upon this product information, Global
Financing continually monitors projections of future equipment values and
compares them with the residual values reflected in the portfolio.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Global Financing
optimizes the recovery of residual values by selling assets sourced from end of
lease, leasing used equipment to new clients, or extending lease arrangements
with current clients. Sales of equipment, which are primarily sourced from
equipment returned at the end of a lease, represented 40.0 percent of Global
Financing&#146;s revenue in the first quarter of 2010 and 36.9 percent in the first
quarter of 2009. The percentage increase was primarily driven by the increase
in internal used equipment sales to the Global Technology Services segment and
the decrease in financing revenue.&#160; The
gross margin on these sales was 50.6 percent and 49.9 percent in the first
quarter of 2010 and 2009, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following table
presents the recorded amount of unguaranteed residual value for sales-type,
direct financing and operating leases at January&nbsp;1, 2010 and March&nbsp;31,
2010. In addition, the table presents the residual value as a percentage of the
related original amount financed and a run out of when the unguaranteed
residual value assigned to equipment on leases at March&nbsp;31, 2010 is
expected to be returned to the company. In addition to the unguaranteed
residual value below, on a limited basis, Global Financing will obtain
guarantees of the future value of the equipment to be returned at end of lease.
These third-party guarantees are included in minimum lease payments as provided
for by accounting standards in the determination of lease classifications for
the covered equipment and provide protection against risk of loss arising from
declines in equipment values for these assets. The residual value guarantee
increases the minimum lease payments that are utilized in determining the
classification of a lease as a sales-type lease or operating lease. The
aggregate asset values associated with the guarantees were $90 million and $106
million for the financing transactions originated during the quarters ended March&nbsp;31,
2010 and March&nbsp;31, 2009, respectively. The associated aggregate guaranteed
future values at the scheduled end of lease were $4 million and $6 million for
the financing transactions originated during the quarters ended March&nbsp;31,
2010 and March&nbsp;31, 2009, respectively. The cost of guarantees was $0.5
million and $0.8 million for the quarters ended March&nbsp;31, 2010 and March&nbsp;31,
2009, respectively.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">58<a name="PB_58_082236_2897"></a></font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>

  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="27%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:27.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Operating leases</font></p>
  </td>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Debt</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="73%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:73.34%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="59%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:59.1%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.4%;">

  </td>
  <td width="16%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:16.36%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">At&nbsp;March&nbsp;31,</font></b></p>

  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.36%;">

  </td>

 <tr>
  <td width="59%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:59.1%;">

  </td>

  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>

  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2010</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.4%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:16.36%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2009</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.36%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="59%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:59.1%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Debt-to-equity ratio</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.4%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:16.36%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">7.0x</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.4%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:16.36%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">7.1x</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.36%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
company funds Global Financing through borrowings using a debt-to-equity ratio
target of approximately 7 to 1. The debt used to fund Global Financing assets
is composed of intercompany loans and external debt. The terms of the</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">intercompany
loans are set by the company to substantially match the term and currency
underlying the financing receivable and are based on arm&#146;s-length pricing. Both
assets and debt are presented in the Global Financing balance sheet on page&nbsp;56.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Global Financing business provides funding predominantly for the company&#146;s
external clients but also provides intercompany financing for the company. As
previously stated, </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the company </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">measures Global Financing as
if it were a standalone entity and accordingly, interest expense relating to
debt supporting Global Financing&#146;s external client and internal</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">business is
included in the &#147;Global Financing Results of Operations&#148; on page&nbsp;55 and in
Segment Information on page&nbsp;24.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:21.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In
the company&#146;s Consolidated Statement of Earnings on page&nbsp;3, however, the
external debt-related interest expense supporting Global Financing&#146;s internal
financing to the company is reclassified from cost of financing to interest
expense.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:21.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following table provides additional information on total company debt.
In this table, intercompany activity includes internal loans and leases at arm&#146;s
length pricing in support of Global Services&#146; long-term contracts and other
internal activity. The company believes these assets should be appropriately
leveraged in line with the overall Global Financing business model.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Liquidity and Capital
Resources</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Global
Financing is a segment of the company and therefore, is supported by the
company&#146;s overall liquidity position and access to capital markets. Cash generated
by Global Financing was primarily deployed to pay intercompany payables and
dividends to the company in order to maintain an appropriate debt-to-equity
ratio.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">59<a name="PB_59_083135_3020"></a></font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

 <tr>
  <td width="65%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:65.4%;">

  income (A)</font></p>

  <td width="65%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:65.4%;">

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left"></div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .2in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">*&#160;&#160; Calculated based upon an
estimated tax rate principally based on Global Financing&#146;s geographic mix of
earnings as IBM&#146;s provision</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">for income taxes is
determined on a consolidated basis.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">** Average of the ending equity for Global Financing for the last 2
quarters.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Looking Forward</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:21.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Global Financing&#146;s
financial position provides flexibility and funding capacity which enables the
company to be well positioned in the current environment. Global Financing&#146;s
assets and new financing volumes are primarily IBM products and services
financed to the company&#146;s clients and business partners, and substantially all
financing assets are IT related assets which provide a stable base of business
for future growth. Global Financing&#146;s offerings are competitive and available
to clients as a result of the company&#146;s borrowing cost and access to the
capital markets. Overall, Global Financing&#146;s originations will be dependent
upon the demand for IT products and services as well as client participation
rates.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:21.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">IBM continues to access
both the short-term commercial paper market and the medium- and long-term debt
markets.&#160; A protracted period where IBM
could not access the capital markets would likely lead to a slowdown in
originations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:21.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Interest rates and the
overall economy (including currency fluctuations) will have an effect on both
revenue and gross profit. The company&#146;s interest rate risk management policy,
however, combined with the Global Financing pricing strategy should mitigate
gross margin erosion due to changes in interest rates.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:21.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The economy could impact
the credit quality of the Global Financing receivables portfolio and therefore
the level of provision for bad debts. Global Financing will continue to apply
rigorous credit policies in both the origination of new business and the
evaluation of the existing portfolio.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:21.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As discussed on page&nbsp;58,
Global Financing has historically been able to manage residual value risk both
through insight into the company&#146;s product cycles, as well as through its
remarketing business.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:17.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Global Financing has policies in place to manage each
of the key risks involved in financing. These policies, combined with product
and client knowledge, should allow for the prudent management of the business
going forward, even during periods of uncertainty with respect to the economy.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">60<a name="PB_60_083328_7748"></a></font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Forward Looking and Cautionary
Statements</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Except for the historical information and discussions
contained herein, statements contained in this release may constitute
forward-looking statements within the meaning of the Private Securities
Litigation Reform Act of 1995.&nbsp; These statements involve a number of
risks, uncertainties and other factors that could cause actual results to
differ materially, including the following: a downturn in economic environment
and corporate IT spending budgets; the company&#146;s failure to meet growth and
productivity objectives; a failure of the company&#146;s innovation initiatives;
risks from investing in growth opportunities; failure of the company&#146;s
intellectual property portfolio to prevent competitive offerings and the
failure of the company to obtain necessary licenses; breaches of data security;
fluctuations in revenues and purchases; impact of local legal, economic,
political and health conditions; adverse effects from environmental matters,
tax matters and the company&#146;s pension plans; ineffective internal controls; the
company&#146;s use of accounting estimates; the company&#146;s ability to attract and
retain key personnel and its reliance on critical skills; impact of
relationships with critical suppliers; currency fluctuations and customer
financing risks; impact of changes in market liquidity conditions and customer
credit risk on receivables; reliance on third party distribution channels; the
company&#146;s ability to successfully manage acquisitions and alliances; risk
factors related to IBM securities; and other risks, uncertainties and factors
discussed in the company&#146;s Form&nbsp;10-Q, Form&nbsp;10-K and in the company&#146;s
other filings with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) or in
materials incorporated therein by reference.&nbsp; The company assumes no
obligation to update or revise any forward-looking statements.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">ITEM</font></b><b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;"> 4.
Controls and Procedures</font></b><a name="Item4_ControlsAndProcedures_090543"></a></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
company&#146;s management evaluated, with the participation of the Chief Executive
Officer and Chief Financial Officer, the effectiveness of the company&#146;s
disclosure controls and procedures as of the end of the period covered by this
report. Based on that evaluation, the Chief Executive Officer and Chief
Financial Officer have concluded that the company&#146;s disclosure controls and
procedures were effective as of the end of the period covered by this report.
There has been no change in the company&#146;s internal control over financial
reporting that occurred during the quarter covered by this report that has
materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the company&#146;s
internal control over financial reporting.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Part&nbsp;</font></b><b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">II</font></b><b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;"> - Other Information</font></b><a name="PartiiOtherInformation_090535"></a></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">ITEM 1.
Legal Proceedings</font></b><a name="Item1_LegalProceedings_090529"></a></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Refer
to Note 15 on pages&nbsp;30 to 32 of this Form&nbsp;10-Q.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">ITEM 2.
Unregistered Sales of Equity Securities and Use of Proceeds and Issuer

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

common stock for the first quarter of 2010.</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>

  <td width="15%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:15.7%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">127.15</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="17%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:17.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">32,204,050</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="17%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:17.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left"></div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">* On April&nbsp;28, 2009 and October&nbsp;27,
2009, the Board of Directors authorized $3.0 billion and $5.0 billion,
respectively, in funds for use in the company&#146;s common stock repurchase
program. The April&nbsp;28, 2009 authorization was fully utilized by late January&nbsp;2010.
In each case, the company stated that it would repurchase shares on the open
market or in private transactions depending on market conditions and it expects
to use cash from operations for the repurchases. The common stock repurchase
program does not have an expiration date. This table does not include shares
tendered to satisfy the exercise price in connection with cashless exercises of
employee stock options or shares tendered to satisfy tax withholding
obligations in connection with employee equity awards.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>
